title: Has anyone successfully filed a UCC-1 form, and received money or eliminated debt?
question: If you have any information about this process please let me know. If someone "redeems their stawman", are they allowed to engage in any kind of public assistance, buy a house, etc.?
answers: You have walked into one of the many fraudulent schemes one can find on the internet (Sovereign Citizens, tax protesters, etc.). I did have a Chapter 11 case in which people tried recording a lot of nonsense UCC's. They got a visit from the FBI to discuss the issue.
Explain to me how filing a UCC-1 form can eliminate debt.

This is the second time in a few days I have seen the term "strawman". I think there must be an epidemic of fraudulent nonsense. All tax avoidance and debt "disappearance" schemes are to be avoided. Using terms you have heard but do not understand is a common technique. You are smart enough to inquire further.

A UCC-1 is a form which is the last step in creating a security interest in personal property and certain "intangibles" and has absoultely nothing to do with receiving money or eliminating debt. the term "redeems their strawman" has absolutely no meaning in law.
